comedian volodymyr zelenskiy, who play ukraine 's president on tv, be lead election. the strong showing reflect the public longing for a fresh leader who have no link to the corruption-ridden ukrainian political elite. kiev, ukraine ( ap ) — early result in ukraine ’ s presidential election show a comedian with no political experience maintain his strong lead against the incumbent president in the first round, set the stage for a runoff in three week. with nearly 70 percent of the polling station count monday, volodymyr zelenskiy have 30 percent of sunday ’ s vote, while incumbent president petro poroshenko be a distant second with just over 16 percent. ex-prime minister yulia tymoshenko trail behind with 13 percent. the result be in sync with a top exit poll. the strong showing for the 41-year-old zelenskiy reflect the public longing for a fresh leader who have no link to the corruption-ridden ukrainian political elite and can offer a new approach to settle the grind five-year conflict with russia-backed separatist in eastern ukraine. “ this be only the first step toward a great victory, ” zelenskiy say after see the exit poll finding. the top two candidate advance to a runoff on april 21. final result in sunday ’ s first round be expect to be announce later monday. zelenskiy dismiss suggestion that he could pool force with tymoshenko to get the backing of her voter in the second round in exchange for form a coalition follow parliamentary election in the fall. “ we aren ’ t make any deal with anyone, ” he say. “ we be young people. we don ’ t want to see all the past in our future, the future of our country. ” like the character he play in a tv sitcom, a schoolteacher turn president, zelenskiy make fight corruption a focus of his candidacy. he propose a lifetime ban on hold public office for anyone convict of graft. he also call for direct negotiation with russia on end the conflict in eastern ukraine. the election be mar by allegation of widespread vote buying. police say they have receive more than 2,100 complaint of violation on vote day alone in addition to hundred of early voting fraud claim, include bribery attempt and remove ballot from poll place. zelenskiy ’ s headquarters allege multiple voting and other cheat on the part of poroshenko ’ s campaign, but election official say the vote take place without significant violation. “ it be important for u to tell you that no systematic violation take place on either the election day or the night follow the election when vote be be count at the local polling station, ” say central election commission head tetyana slipachuk. poroshenko look somber a the vote come in, but visibly relieve about surpass tymoshenko to advance to the runoff. “ i critically and soberly understand the signal that society give today to the act authority, ” he say. “ it ’ s a tough lesson for me and my team. it ’ s a reason for serious work to correct mistake make over the past years. ” it be not clear whether he would or could adjust his campaign enough to meet zelenskiy ’ s challenge over the next three week. poroshenko, 53, a confectionery tycoon before he be elect five year ago, saw approval of his govern sink amid ukraine ’ s economic woe and a sharp plunge in living standard. poroshenko campaign on promise to defeat the rebel in the east and to wrest back control of crimea, which russia annex in 2014 in a move that have draw sanction against russia from the u.s. and the european union. a military embezzlement scheme that allegedly involve top poroshenko associate, as well a a factory control by the president, dog poroshenko before this election. ultra-right activist shadow him throughout the campaign, demand the jailing of the president ’ s associate accuse in the scandal. poroshenko after the vote hit back at zelenskiy, describe him a a pawn of self-exiled billionaire businessman igor kolomoyskyi, charge that zelenskiy denies. “ fate pit me against kolomoyskyi ’ s puppet in the runoff, ” he say. “ we win ’ t leave a single chance for kolomoyskyi. ” zelenskiy quickly shoot back, say mockingly that it ’ s impossible to say whether a corrupt official involve in the military embezzlement scheme be poroshenko ’ s puppet, or the other way round. with the lineup for the runoff become clear, voter be pick side. “ poroshenko be take the country forward, ” say serhiy poltorachenko, a bank employee. “ he make mistake, but promise to correct them. poroshenko will win because ukrainians win ’ t like to have a clown at the country ’ s helm. ” petro demidchenko, a 38-year-old office worker, say he be support zelenskiy even though he be an unknown quantity. “ we don ’ t know what to expect from zelenskiy, but over the past five year we have find out what to expect from poroshenko — corruption, soar price, continue war and poverty, ” he say.

official : 1 dead, 17 hurt in north carolina gas explosion. durham fire chief robert zoldos say the blast at 10:07 a.m. involved five building on the block and catastrophically damage one. durham, n.c. ( ap ) — a leaking gas line explode wednesday in a durham shopping district, kill one person and injure more than a dozen others a firefighter be evacuate people from building near the rupture, authority say. the blast reverberate across the north carolina city — turn one building to rubble, shatter window block away and fill the air with acrid smoke. jim rogalski, 58, be work in his office across the street from the destroyed building when the explosion blow out the window. at least four people work in cubicle by the window suffer deep cut, bloody head wound and other injury, he say. “ there be lot of scream.... ” rogalski say. “ it be pretty frantic there for a little bit until help show up. ” rogalski be seat one row away from the window and wasn ’ t hurt. “ it be terrify, ” he say. “ the whole building shook. thing start fall — ceiling tile, and structure and glass and debris. lot and lot of dust. it be tough to see beyond 20 foot or so. ” the explosion come about 15 minute after the office ’ s human resource manager send an email warning that the city ’ s fire department be investigate the smell of gas and that worker shouldn ’ t leave the building through the front door, he say a a friend give him a ride home to chapel hill. rogalski say he be force to abandon his car in a nearby parking deck because authority worry the blast may have weaken the structure. durham fire chief robert zoldos say the blast at 10:07 a.m. involved five building on the block and catastrophically damage one. the leak have be report during construction a half-hour earlier, prompt the evacuation. on wednesday afternoon, jag beams jut out of the collapsed building, along with bent sheet metal, brick and wood. it roof have completely fall in, and the partly caved-in roof of an adjacent building cascade into the rubble pile. a massive stream of water from a ladder truck spray onto the remnant, drain down the street a firefighter walk past. now that the fire have be contain, crew will begin search and rescue operation, zoldos say at a news conference. no one be unaccounted for, the chief say, but they ’ ll use dog and listen device to make sure no one be inside the rubble. a total of 17 people be see at hospital — six in critical condition and one transport to a burn center — durham ems assistant chief lee van vleet say. zoldos say one firefighter be seriously injured and in surgery but expect to recover. zoldos say the cause of the explosion be still under investigation. a contractor bore under a sidewalk have hit a 2-inch ( 5-centimeter ) gas line, cause the leak, durham police department spokesman wil glenn say. glenn link the boring work to the explosion during a morning briefing, but zoldos later say the cause be still under investigation. dominion energy say in a press release wednesday that subsidiary company psnc energy have receive a call about “ third-party ” damage to a natural gas line in durham. a psnc worker respond, and the explosion “ occur shortly thereafter. ” the company say additional crew arrive and shut off the gas. deputy city manager bo ferguson say boring for a fiber communication network have be underway in the area, but city official be work to confirm that and couldn ’ t release the name of the contractor. block away, the blast shatter window and blew at least one door off it hinge in the brightleaf shopping district. ed rain be on a nearby street and couldn ’ t see the blast but hear it. “ i think someone have drop a dumpster on the street, ” he say. tracy telenko be at his desk in his third-floor durham office when he hear the explosion and saw black smoke billow up. “ my first think, because there be construction go on around my building, be something fell, somebody do construction drop something, ” he say. telenko say he go home after his bos tell employee they could leave if they didn ’ t feel safe in their office. at nearby durham school of the art, student be evacuate and class dismiss for the day. teacher al donaldson be walk through a hallway in a building about two block from the blast when he hear a loud noise, which concern faculty and student. “ we didn ’ t know the origin at the time, ” he say. “ i be in the hallway, so i didn ’ t so much feel it shake a experience a jarring sound. ” the collapsed building be occupy by prescient co., which say in july 2017 that it be move it headquarters from arvada, colorado, and expect to employ about 60 executive, engineering and sale worker in durham. the company use specialized software to design and build precise material that allow builder to assemble multistory apartment, hotel and other commercial building faster and cheap. ___ emery p. dalesio and martha waggoner in raleigh ; tom foreman jr. in charlotte ; and ben finley in norfolk, virginia, contribute to this story. ___ this story have be edit to clarify that the explosion cause the entire roof of one building to cave in while the roof of an adjacent building partly collapse.

trump finally switch up his lie that china pay tariff to the u.s. treasury. instead, he falsely claim that tariff boost america 's gdp. president donald trump have finally drop his ruse that china pay tariff to the u.s. instead, he emphasize another trade lie on monday. trump have repeatedly insist that china pay tariff directly to the u.s. government. but it ’ s actually u.s. importer who pay tariff for chinese good, and they pass those cost to u.s. consumer in the form of high product price. trump finally appear to concede in a tweet that american be the one who really shoulder tariff cost. but he say “ there be no reason ” they have to pay them — as long a they buy from a “ non-tariffed country. ” many american good, however, contain part from different country, so it ’ s difficult to dodge product that aren ’ t affect by tariff. trump also say tariff cost can be avoid if product be purchase “ inside the usa, ” but that ’ s clearly not the case with product hit by tariff — even if people buy them in the u.s. trump also tweet — again — that tariff have help the u.s. economy, which be not true accord to his own economic adviser. “ some people just don ’ t get it! ” trump write. white house chief economic adviser larry kudlow concede to chris wallace on fox news sunday that trump ’ s tariff have hurt job as well a gdp. he estimate that loss to be about two-tenths of 1 percent of gdp — low than many economist ’ estimate — and call it a “ very modest number ” and “ so small. ” but the washington post note that kudlow ’ s estimate amount to about $ 40 billion. in addition, trade fear send global stock market plunge monday, wipe out $ 1 trillion in value around the world, bloomberg report. kudlow also admit to wallace — despite trump ’ s earlier claim — that american pay the cost of the tariff. china announce monday it will hike tariff june 1 on $ 60 billion of u.s. import in retaliation for the trump administration ’ s increase tariff on $ 200 billion worth of chinese good last week.

do face mask really protect you from get sick?. expert explain if medical face mask work against illness like the coronavirus. coronavirus, which cause the respiratory illness covid-19, have morph into a global pandemic. because the virus can be spread easily, many have resort wear face mask to protect themselves, a the virus be transmissible through human contact and exposure to respiratory droplet from an infected person. but even though people be rush to get their hand on a medical face mask, expert be somewhat skeptical about how effective they be in protect people against dangerous virus and bacteria. below be their take on whether or not you should wear a mask and how else you can protect yourself. there be a couple different way virus such a this one can go around. when an infected person cough or sneeze, they expel respiratory droplet into the air that carry the virus. they can also spread those droplet around if they touch their eye and nose then touch another person or surface. if someone be to come into contact with these contagious droplet — either in the air or by touch a surface that contain the droplet — they, too, could get sick. there be some evidence that, when use correctly, face mask can slow the spread of airborne virus. for example, one study from 2008 find that those who use a mask be 80 % less likely to get the flu. another 2009 report find that, in tandem with frequent hand-washing, face mask lower people ’ s risk of get the flu by about 70 %. but the mask aren ’ t foolproof, and just because you ’ re wear one do not mean you ’ re in the clear. “ mask of any kind would be helpful because then they be cover up your nose and mouth so they aren ’ t go to touch those, but they still leave your eye open so you can touch and transmit the virus that way, ” michael ison, an infectious disease specialist with northwestern medicine, tell huffpost. when we look back at the severe acute respiratory syndrome ( sars ) epidemic that struck in 2003, researcher conclude that face mask play some role in slow down the spread — especially in a hospital set — but mostly because they prevent sick people from pass sars around. in fact, most people in asia wear the mask not to avoid get sick themselves but to protect other people from harmful germ and virus. in 2012, when another deadly coronavirus — middle east respiratory syndrome ( mers ) — strike, health official recommend wear a face mask only if you be in the same room a a person with mers. there just wasn ’ t enough evidence on if mask have any role in halt the spread of mers. the main takeaway here : mask alone win ’ t eliminate your risk of contract the coronavirus. but, they may help. “ it can reduce the risk of some transmission, but doesn ’ t take the risk to zero, ” ison say. there be two type of face mask that can help cut your odds of get coronavirus : surgical face mask and respirator, also know a n-95 mask. the one we ’ re see all over the news? those be surgical face mask, and what doctor, dentist and nurse use while treat patient. while they do protect people from splash and spray to a degree, they aren ’ t foolproof. they ’ re loose-fitting and relatively thin, so tiny droplet can still seep in through the part of the mask. “ [ surgical ] mask do provide a degree of protection against fluid, include spray from a cough or sneeze, and they provide some filtration of the air. however, since the mask do not provide a tight seal around the wearer ’ s nose and mouth, much of the air inhale and exhale be unfiltered, ” say richard martinello, a yale medicine infectious disease specialist. then, there be respirator, commonly use by construction worker. they ’ re heavy-duty, and be form fit to your face. accord to the center for disease control and prevention, these mask filter out about 95 % of airborne particle, include virus and bacteria. but, they aren ’ t so comfortable and many people report trouble breathe while wear them, make them difficult to wear for hour on end. respirator can get clog and cause people ’ s breathing and heart rate to soar, so pregnant people or individual with breathe problem should consult a doctor before use one. it isn ’ t an essential need for everyone to wear face mask, accord to the cdc. many expert stress that the main point of them be to keep someone who be already sick from infect others. “ we generally do not recommend the use of either mask or respirator for the general public. of course, person who desire to be extra cautious about their exposure to germ when in public may choose to wear a mask, ” martinello say. there be some exception : the world health organization urge that if you ’ re healthy, you should wear a mask if you ’ re take care of a person suspect of have covid-19. neil fishman, the chief medical officer of the hospital of the university of pennsylvania, also tell the new york time that “ for individual work in certain essential industry, where they still have to go out every day, i think wear a mask make sense. ” how well the mask work largely depend on if you ’ re be wear it correctly. make sure the correct side be face outward, keep the mask snug over your nose, secure the loop behind your ear, and close off the gap around your jawline. martinello say the big mistake people make be when the mask cover their mouth but not their nose. there be other step you can take to keep yourself healthy. for one, keep a distance from sick people, especially those cough or sneeze. also, not touch your face with your hand minimize your exposure to harmful germ. lastly, hand-washing be your best line of defense against any virus, so wash frequently and thoroughly. that mean spending at least 20 second scrub your hand with soap and rinsing water. this story have be update to reflect new information about the spread of the coronavirus.
